question: Among the following, identify the compound that is not an isomer of hexane
images/2025-chem-21-1.png
explanation: Isomers of hexane must have the molecular formula <katex>$\text{C}_6\text{H}_{14}$</katex>.
The compound in option (3) likely has a different carbon count or formula (<katex>$\text{C}_6\text{H}_{12}$</katex> or similar) based on the solution.
